data.name: ResourceTypeHelpText
data.value: Specify the type of resource to be created by the activity.

data.name: AdvancedFeaturesHelpText
data.value: Select this option to configure advanced behavior for the activity.

data.name: QueryResourcesHelpText
data.value: The activity can be configured to query resources which can be used in update definitions.

data.name: QueriesHelpText
data.value: Specify one or more XPath queries which should be run by the activity. Queries can be referenced in expressions using lookups with the [//Queries/Key/...] grammar.

data.name: ConditionHelpText
data.value: Optionally specify a condition which must be satisfied for execution of the activity's core task. This can be any WAL function expression resolving to a boolean value.

data.name: IterationHelpText
data.value: Optionally configure the activity to iterate through a collection of values by specifying a lookup or expression. The instance value can be referenced in update definitions using lookups with the [//Value/…] grammar. Note: Iteration will disable publication of created and conflicting resource IDs.

data.name: ApplyAuthorizationPolicyHelpText
data.value: The activity can be configured to apply authorization policy to child requests. Note: Authorization policy will disable publication of the create resource ID.

data.name: TargetForCreatedResourceIDHelpText
data.value: The activity can be configured to publish the ID of the new resource to an attribute or workflow dictionary key after creation. The target must be expressed as a lookup.

data.name: CheckForConflictHelpText
data.value: The activity can be configured to check for a conflict before creating the new resource.

data.name: ConflictingResourceSearchFilterHelpText
data.value: Supply the resolvable XPath search filter which will return any conflicting resource. Example: /Group[DisplayName = 'DL_Location_[//Target/OfficeLocation]']

data.name: TargetForConflictingResourceIDHelpText
data.value: The activity can be configured to publish the ID of the identified conflicting resource to an attribute or workflow dictionary key. The target must be expressed as a lookup.

data.name: FailOnConflictHelpText
data.value: Specify whether or not the activity should generate an error when a conflict is identified.

data.name: AttributesPopulationHelpText
data.value: Specify how attributes are to be populated on the new resource. Lookups are used in value expressions, but an attribute name must be specified as the target. Variables may also be specified as a target and then used in the value expression for subsequent definitions.

data.name: ActorTypeExpressionHelpText
data.value: Specify the lookup or expression which will resolve to the desired actor.

data.name: ActorTypeAccountNameHelpText
data.value: Specify the account name of the desired actor. The domain can optionally be specified using the Domain\AccountName syntax.

data.name: InvalidActorType
data.value: The supplied value could not be matched to a value for the ActorType enumeration

data.name: QueryDefintionRightValidationError
data.value: The XPath filter supplied for key '{0}' is invalid

data.name: ConflictResourceSearchFilterValidationError
data.value: The supplied conflicting resource search filter is invalid

data.name: TargetForDeletionHelpText
data.value: Specify how the activity will identify the target(s) for deletion.

data.name: TargetLookupHelpText
data.value: Supply the lookup which will identify the target(s) for deletion. Example: [//Target/OwnedAccounts]

data.name: TargetSearchFilterHelpText
data.value: Supply the resolvable XPath search filter which will return the target(s) for deletion. Example: /Account[AccountOwner = '[//Target/ObjectID]']

data.name: TargetForGeneratedValueHelpText
data.value: Specify the attribute or workflow dictionary key to which the generated value should be published. The target must be expressed as a lookup.

data.name: ConflictFilterHelpText
data.value: Supply the XPath filter which will identify conflicts for the generated value. The [//Value] lookup should be used in the filter to represent the value being evaluated for uniqueness. Example: /Person[AccountName = '[//Value]'].

data.name: QueryLdapForConflictsHelpText
data.value: The activity can be configured to query one or more LDAP directories to identify conflicts for the generated value.

data.name: LdapQueriesHelpText
data.value: Specify one or more LDAP queries which should be run by the activity to identify conflicts. The [//Value] lookup should be used in each LDAP filter to represent the value being evaluated for uniqueness. All queries will be executed under the context of the FIM Service account.

data.name: UniquenessKeySeedHelpText
data.value: Specify the first number which should be included in the value when all other expressions result in a conflict.

data.name: ValueExpressionsHelpText
data.value: Supply the expressions which will be used to generate the unique value. The first expression which results in a unique value will be used. The last expression in the list must contain the [//UniquenessKey] lookup to ensure a unique value can be generated. As a last resort, this lookup will be replaced with an integer which will be incremented until a unique value is identified.

data.name: QueryDefinitionValidationError
data.value: One or more query definitions are incomplete

data.name: TargetLookupValidationError
data.value: {0} is not a valid target lookup

data.name: AttributeDefinitionValidationError
data.value: One or more attribute assignment definitions are incomplete

data.name: QueryResourcesValidationError
data.value: The activity is not configured to query resources. Expressions using the [//Query/Key/...] syntax cannot be used.

data.name: IterationValidationError
data.value: The activity is not configured for iteration. Expressions using the [//Value/...] syntax cannot be used.

data.name: ConflictFilterValidationError
data.value: The supplied conflict filter is invalid

data.name: ConflictFilterValueLookupValidationError
data.value: The conflict filter must contain the [//Value] lookup

data.name: LdapQueryDefinitionValidationError
data.value: One or more LDAP query definitions are incomplete

data.name: LdapQueryDefinitionValueLookupValidationError
data.value: All LDAP filters must contain the [//Value] lookup

data.name: ValueExpressionMissingUniquenessKeyValidationError
data.value: The last value expression in the list must contain the [//UniquenessKey] lookup.

data.name: PowerShellScriptLocationHelpText
data.value: Specify how the activity will locate the script for execution.

data.name: PowerShellScriptHelpText
data.value: Supply the PowerShell script that will be executed by the activity. The script will be stored in the workflow definition as an activity configuration property.

data.name: FailOnMissingScriptHelpText
data.value: Specify whether or not the activity should generate an error when the script lookup resolves to a null value.

data.name: PowerShellScriptInputTypeHelpText
data.value: If input is required, specify how it should be provided to the PowerShell script.

data.name: NamedParametersHelpText
data.value: Specify one or more named parameters to be supplied to the script upon execution. Value expressions may include functions, lookups, and concatenation.

data.name: ScriptArgumentsHelpText
data.value: Specify one or more arguments to be supplied to the script upon execution. Arguments will be provided, without parameter names, in the order in which they are listed. Value expressions may include functions, lookups, and concatenation.

data.name: ScriptReturnTypeHelpText
data.value: The activity can capture a return value from the PowerShell script and publish it to a lookup. Alternatively, the PowerShell script may return a table of named values which can be published to the workflow dictionary using corresponding key names.

data.name: ScriptReturnValueLookupHelpText
data.value: Specify the lookup to which the return value should be published.

data.name: ScriptParameterDefintionValidationError
data.value: One or more parameter definitions are incomplete

data.name: ScriptArgumentValidationError
data.value: One or more arguments are incomplete

data.name: PowerShellScriptPathHelpText
data.value: Specify the full path to the PowerShell script file. This path must be accessible from all instances of the FIM Service.

data.name: PowerShellScriptLookupHelpText
data.value: Specify the lookup which represents the script to be executed by the activity.

data.name: InvalidPowerShellScriptLocation
data.value: The supplied value could not be matched to a value for the PowerShellScriptLocation enumeration

data.name: InvalidPowerShellInputType
data.value: The supplied value could not be matched to a value for the PowerShellInputType enumeration

data.name: InvalidPowerShellReturnType
data.value: The supplied value could not be matched to a value for the PowerShellReturnType enumeration

data.name: UpdatesHelpText
data.value: Specify the updates to be performed by the activity. Lookups are used in value expressions and are also used to represent target resources and attributes. Variables may also be specified as a target and then used in the value expression for subsequent update definitions. The "Allow Null" option enforces the deletion of target values when the source resolves to null.

data.name: UpdateDefinitionValidationError
data.value: One or more update definitions are incomplete

data.name: VerifyResourceUniquenessHelpText
data.value: Specify whether or not a uniqueness validation should be performed for the target resource.

data.name: ConflictingResourceSearchFilterHelpText2
data.value: Supply the resolvable XPath search filter which will return any conflicting resource. Example: /Person[EmployeeID = '[//Effective/EmployeeID]']

data.name: ConflictDenialMessageHelpText
data.value: Supply the resolvable denial message to be returned to the user when a conflicting resource is found.

data.name: VerifyRequestUniquenessHelpText
data.value: Specify whether or not a uniqueness validation should be performed for the request against other authorizing requests.

data.name: AdvancedRequestSearchFilterHelpText
data.value: Optionally supply the resolvable XPath search filter which will return requests that should be evaluated as potential conflicts. If not supplied, the activity will evaluate all requests with a status of 'Authorizing' and a matching target resource type and operation.

data.name: RequestConflictMatchCondition
data.value: Match Condition Identifying a Conflicting Request

data.name: RequestConflictMatchConditionHelpText
data.value: Supply the Boolean condition which identifies an evaluated request as a conflict. Example: And(Eq([//Delta/AccountName], [//ComparedRequest/Delta/AccountName]), Eq([//Delta/Domain], [//ComparedRequest/Delta/Domain]))

data.name: RequestConflictDenialMessageHelpText
data.value: Supply the resolvable denial message to be returned to the user when a conflicting request is found.

data.name: RequiredRequestConditionsHelpText
data.value: Specify the conditions which must be satisfied for the request to be considered valid. The activity supports the specification of function-based conditions which reference resolvable expressions. If any condition does not evaluate to true, the request will be denied with the associated error message.

data.name: RequiredRequestConditionsRightHeader
data.value: Denial Message if Condition is not Satisfied

data.name: ConditionDefinitionValidationError
data.value: One or more condition definitions are incomplete

data.name: ConditionEvaluationValidationError
data.value: All conditions must resolve to a Boolean value

data.name: RequiredFieldValidationError
data.value: A value must be supplied for {0}

data.name: NumericFieldValidationError
data.value: A valid integer must be supplied for {0}

data.name: GuidFieldValidationError
data.value: A valid Guid must be supplied for {0}

data.name: NullDefinitionListingsError
data.value: The list of definition listings is null

data.name: FormControlInitializationError
data.value: The control must be initialized before it can be added to the form controller

data.name: ActivityDisplayNameControlValidationError
data.value: An activity display name text box control has already been added to the controller

data.name: TargetLookupExpressionMissingValidationError
data.value: A Target Lookup must be supplied.

data.name: TargetXPathExpressionMissingValidationError
data.value: A Search Target XPath must be supplied.

data.name: DefinitionsConverter_NullOrEmptyDefinitionsTableError
data.value: The definitions table is null or corrupt

data.name: ValueExpressionUniquenessKeyValidationError
data.value: Only the last value expression in the list can leverage the [//UniquenessKey] lookup.

data.name: ValueExpressionValidationError
data.value: One or more value expressions are incomplete.

data.name: ImpersonatePowerShellUserHelpText
data.value: Impersonate the specified PowerShell user while running the PowerShell script.

data.name: ImpersonationLogonTypeHelpText
data.value: Log on type to use when impersonating the PowerShell user.

data.name: ImpersonationLogOnTypeLogOnBatch
data.value: Log on as a batch job

data.name: ImpersonationLogOnTypeLogOnNetworkClearText
data.value: Network log on with plain text

data.name: InvalidLogOnType
data.value: The supplied value could not be matched to a value for the LogOnType enumeration.

data.name: LoadUserProfileHelpText
data.value: Load user profile when impersonating the PowerShell user.

data.name: PowerShellUserHelpText
data.value: Specify the user in the format domain\userName to be used to construct PowerShell Credential object.

data.name: PowerShellUserPasswordHelpText
data.value: Specify the password to be used to construct PowerShell Credential object. The expected format is: [base64EncodedEncryptedData] | [app:\appSettings\[key],[LocalMachine|CurrentUser]] | [cert:\[LocalMachine|CurrentUser]\my\[thumbprint],base64EncodedEncryptedData]]

data.name: PowerShellImpersonationSettingsValidationError
data.value: Specify UserName and Password of the impersonated user.

data.name: PowerShellUserFormatValidationError
data.value: Specify the PowerShell user in the format domain\userName.

data.name: RequestActorValidationError
data.value: Authorization Policy cannot be applied when Request Actor is Service Account

data.name: AddDelayTimeoutDurationHelpText
data.value: Specify a TimeSpan value or expression in "hours:minutes:seconds" format (e.g. "00:30:00" for 30 minutes)

data.name: SendEmailNotificationBccHelpText
data.value: Specify a search filter, a lookup expression or a ';' delimited list of email addresses.

data.name: SendEmailNotificationCCHelpText
data.value: Specify a search filter, a lookup expression or a ';' delimited list of email addresses.

data.name: SendEmailNotificationEmailTemplateHelpText
data.value: Specify an XPath to an EmailTemplate resource or a lookup expression resolving to an EmailTemplate resource.

data.name: SendEmailNotificationEmailTemplateValidationError
data.value: If the supplied Email Template value is not an XPath filter or a lookup expression, it must be a valid GUID value.

data.name: SendEmailNotificationToHelpText
data.value: Specify a search filter, a lookup expression or a ';' delimited list of email addresses.

data.name: SendEmailNotificationSuppressExceptionHelpText
data.value: Suppresses notification failure from the EmailNotification Activity.

data.name: RequestApprovalApproversHelpText
data.value: User and groups who can approve this request. Specify a search filter, a lookup expression or a ';' delimited list of email addresses.

data.name: RequestApprovalCompleteEmailTemplateHelpText
data.value: This email is sent to approvers. Specify a search filter or a lookup expression.

data.name: RequestApprovalDeniedEmailTemplateHelpText
data.value: This email is sent to requestor. Specify a search filter or a lookup expression.

data.name: RequestApprovalDurationHelpText
data.value: Number of days before escalation and time out. Specify a lookup expression or a number.

data.name: RequestApprovalEmailTemplateHelpText
data.value: This email is sent to approvers. Specify a search filter or a lookup expression.

data.name: RequestApprovalEmailTemplateValidationError
data.value: If the supplied Email Template value is not an XPath filter or a lookup expression, it must be a valid GUID value.

data.name: RequestApprovalEscalationEmailTemplateHelpText
data.value: This email is sent to escalated approvers. Specify a search filter or a lookup expression.

data.name: RequestApprovalEscalationHelpText
data.value: User and groups who can approve this request after it has been escalated. Specify a search filter, a lookup expression or a ';' delimited list of email addresses.

data.name: RequestApprovalThresholdFieldValidationError
data.value: Threshold field must be a lookup expression or a number.

data.name: RequestApprovalThresholdHelpText
data.value: Number of approvers required. Specify a lookup expression or a number.

data.name: RequestApprovalTimeoutEmailTemplateHelpText
data.value: This email is sent to requestor. Specify a search filter or a lookup expression.

data.name: RequestApprovalDurationFieldValidationError
data.value: Specify a lookup expression or a number for the approval duration.

data.name: RequestApprovalEscalationEmailTemplateFieldValidationError
data.value: Escalation email template is required when escalated approvers are specified.

data.name: ActivityExecutionConditionValidationError
data.value: The activity execution condition must be a boolean function. Consider wrapping your current condition inside a ConvertToBoolean() function.
